translated: Birth Stories
The Fours
The Kāliṅga Group
The Birth Story of Daddara
“These things torment me, Daddara,
the harsh words in the human world;
The one who eats frogs and lives in the water,
the poisonous snake spits poison at me.”
“One who has been banished from his own country,
and has gone to another country,
should build a large storehouse
to store up harsh words.
Where they do not know him,
by birth or by training,
there he should not be conceited,
among people who do not know him.
While living in a foreign land,🔽even with one who is not a kinsman,
the wise one should endure,
even if he is scolded by a slave.”
The Birth Story of Daddara, the fourth.
